intro: Psychotria polycarpa, commonly known as the red psychotria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a small, dark red berry that contains several seeds. Psychotria polycarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
